headline: Green Gold Energy bags GPS approval for 108MW solar-plus-storage site in South Australia
summary_80w: Green Gold Energy’s Morgan Solar Farm in South Australia has reached a key grid-connection milestone, having received its Section 5.3.4 letter under the National Electricity Rules (NER).

headline: Engie acquires Australia’s first large-scale BESS built on a decommissioned coal plant, from Eku
summary_80w: Engie has acquired a 30% equity stake in the Hazelwood battery energy storage system (BESS) in Victoria, Australia.

headline: Inside the US solar supply chain labyrinth
summary_80w: To say that it has been a busy time for the US solar industry lately would be an understatement, especially at the policy and tariff level.

headline: Yield Energy launches farm-based grid flexibility platform
summary_80w: Yield Energy has launched Yield Edge, a distributed energy resource management system (DERMS) for grid-ready flexibility from farms.

headline: Solar PV corporate funding decreased to US$22.2 billion in 2025
summary_80w: Total corporate funding in the solar PV industry reached US$22.2 billion in 2025, a 16% year-on-year decrease.

headline: United Solar to begin polysilicon production at Oman plant in Q1 2026
summary_80w: Solar polysilicon manufacturer United Solar Holding has secured over US$900 million in financing for its polysilicon plant in Oman.

headline: Five Chinese PV giants anticipate combined 2025 losses of US$4.1-4.7 billion
summary_80w: LONGi Green, Tongwei, JA Solar, TCL Zhonghuan and Aiko Solar are projecting a combined 2025 deficit of RMB28.9-32.8 billion (US$4.1-4.7 billion).

headline: Quantifying the impact of quality control on ground-based GHI measurements
summary_80w: Without quality control, even expensive, high-precision radiometers can generate misleading data, according to Solargis' Marcel Suri.

headline: Estuary Power completes final phase of Escape solar-plus-storage project in Nevada
summary_80w: Energy generation and storage developer Estuary Power has completed the final phase of construction at its Escape solar project in Lincoln County, Nevada.

headline: US patent office denies challenges to First Solar TOPCon patents
summary_80w: The USPTO has denied three challenges to patents held by US solar manufacturer First Solar pertaining to its production of TOPCon cells.

headline: 5B’s ‘Maverick’ helps Australian off-grid gold mine set 101-hour renewable energy record
summary_80w: Bellevue Gold has claimed to have set a new benchmark for off-grid renewable energy performance at one of its gold mines.

headline: Large-Scale Fire Testing (LSFT): from best practice to mandatory requirement
summary_80w: BESS Large-Scale Fire Testing (LSFT) has been adopted as part of best practice thinking on safety validation, with at least a dozen companies announcing tests and results and many more expected going forward. It becomes mandatory in the 2026 edition of NFPA 855.

headline: Amazon buys ready-to-build Oregon solar-plus-storage project from bankrupt developer Pine Gate
summary_80w: Amazon has been approved as the buyer of the 1.2GW Sunstone solar project in Oregon, one of the largest solar PV projects in the US.

headline: Virginia proposes 20.78GW storage mandate as Trump, governors call for emergency PJM grid measures
summary_80w: Virginia's recently proposed legislation to significantly increase energy storage requirements coincides with unprecedented electricity demand growth in the state, largely driven by data centres.

headline: UK battery storage development market moves from speculation to execution
summary_80w: The UK market saw strong interest and activity in 2025 but now appears to be shifting from a development market to one focused on execution, writes Solar Media analyst Charlotte Gisbourne.

headline: Over 2GWh of Europe BESS completed, financed and transacted in past week
summary_80w: Another roundup of European grid-scale BESS project news, led by MORE and Zenobe putting Greece and UK projects into operation, and major project financings/construction starts by Acacia in France, Greenvolt in Hungary and Eco Stor in Germany.

headline: Year in Review: BESS industry maturing through ‘growing pains’ says Wärtsilä software VP
summary_80w: Luke Witmer, VP of software engineering at Wärtsilä Energy Storage, explains why 2025 was an “awkward” year, but one that saw the industry grow taller than ever.

headline: Battery trading performance: Demystifying normalised revenue and percent of perfect foresight
summary_80w: Sahand Karimi and Henry Swisher of OptiGrid examine the two primary metrics used to evaluate the performance of battery storage trading: normalised revenue and percentage of perfect capture rate.

headline: INDIA SOLAR ROUND-UP: Hartek wins EPC contract, Waaree bags 2GW+ module orders
summary_80w: INDIA ROUND-UP: Hartek Power, Waaree Energies, Kosol Energie and IREDA secured major solar and renewable energy deals, including EPC contracts, multi-gigawatt module orders, multi-billion-dollar investments, and international project financing.

headline: UK developers grappling with grid connection reform and LDES scheme implications
summary_80w: While the UK grid-scale BESS market continues to be among the busiest in Europe, there are still huge questions and plenty work to be done in several key policy areas.

headline: EU’s revised cybersecurity law targets ‘high risk’ suppliers
summary_80w: The European Commission has released its proposal to revise its Cybersecurity Act (CSA), which includes provisions to exclude “high-risk” companies and components from European supply chains.

headline: Radial Power secures US$355 million financing for 214MW solar portfolio
summary_80w: Radial Power has secured US$355 million from Goldman Sachs for 214MW of distributed solar across 106 projects nationwide.

headline: Buyers’ sentiment declines, solar module prices hold steady in Europe in December
summary_80w: Sentiment among Europe’s solar buyers dropped to the lowest levels on record at the end of 2025, according to sun.store's pv.index report.

headline: Colombia commits US$1.7 billion to Caribbean grid development, eyes 6GW of renewables
summary_80w: The Colombian government has announced a grid expansion plan which it says will facilitate up to 6GW of new clean energy capacity in the country’s Caribbean region.

headline: CleanPeak Energy acquires five Australian solar-plus-storage sites from Fortitude Renewables
summary_80w: CleanPeak Energy has completed the acquisition of five solar and battery energy storage system (BESS) development sites in New South Wales from Fortitude Renewables, adding 25MW of solar capacity and 100MWh of battery storage to its portfolio.

headline: Year in Review: Law firm Troutman Pepper Locke on FEOC and the ‘privileged status’ of battery storage
summary_80w: Year in Review series perspectives, from FEOC to data centres, from Vaughn Morrison, partner at US law firm Troutman Pepper Locke.

headline: Rondo Energy, Covestro break ground on 100MWh thermal energy storage site in Germany
summary_80w: Covestro and startup Rondo Energy have broken ground on a 100MWh TES system at Covestro's Brunsbüttel chemical site in Germany.

headline: India’s energy storage market in 2025: From tenders to scaled deployment
summary_80w: IESA president Debmalya Sen talks us through the highlights and challenges of the past year, as India gets to grips with market development and acceleration.

headline: ANZA Power secures US$300 million from I Squared for Australia-New Zealand portfolio
summary_80w: Global infrastructure investor I Squared Capital has launched ANZA Power, a next-generation independent power producer (IPP) in Australia and New Zealand.

headline: Akaysha Energy switches on 410MWh grid-forming BESS in Australia five months ahead of schedule
summary_80w: BlackRock-backed Akaysha Energy has commenced operations at its 205MW/410MWh Brendale battery energy storage system (BESS) in Queensland, Australia, delivering the project close to five months ahead of the original schedule.

headline: RES Australia joint venture submits 450MW solar-plus-storage site to EPBC Act
summary_80w: Wooderson Solar Development Co has submitted a 450MW solar-plus-storage project in Queensland to Australia's EPBC Act.

headline: SunPower buys Cobalt Power Systems as standalone subsidiary
summary_80w: US solar firm SunPower has signed a letter of intent to acquire California-based residential and commercial installer Cobalt Power Systems in an all-equity transaction.

headline: GCL to build 5GW solar cell, module manufacturing facility in Egypt
summary_80w: Egyptian manufacturing firm Kemet has signed a deal with Chinese solar manufacturer GCL Technologies to build a 5GW solar cell and module manufacturing hub in the country.

headline: Masdar, Engie complete financing for 1.5GW Khazna solar plant
summary_80w: Emirati renewables developer Masdar and French utility Engie have reached financial close on the 1.5GW Khazna solar project in Abu Dhabi.

headline: Two-thirds of electricity demand growth in the US came from solar PV in 2025 – Ember
summary_80w: Solar PV has met two-thirds (61%) of the US electricity demand growth in 2025, according to a report from think tank Ember.

headline: Industry body warns of investment freeze in Polish renewables from proposed grid laws
summary_80w: Private investment in Poland’s renewable energy projects risks being blocked by proposed regulations governing grid connections.

headline: Egg Power lands US$536 million financing to build UK and European renewables
summary_80w: Egg Power has secured £400 million (US$536 million) in debt financing from NatWest to develop large-scale renewable energy projects across Europe.

headline: Daqo New Energy expects to halve losses in 2025 as polysilicon sector shifts
summary_80w: Chinese polysilicon producer Daqo New Energy recorded over RMB1 billion in losses in 2025, roughly halving its losses compared with 2024.

headline: China implements anti-dumping duties on US and South Korean solar-grade polysilicon
summary_80w: Last week, the Chinese Ministry of Commerce (MoC) issued its final review ruling regarding anti-dumping measures on solar-grade polysilicon originating in the US and South Korea.

headline: TCL Zhonghuan bids for controlling stake in DAS Solar to optimise cell and module business
summary_80w: Chinese wafer producer TCL Zhonghuan is planning to take a controlling stake in cell and module manufacturer DAS Solar to strengthen its vertical integration.

headline: Lava Blue, HaloCell partner to develop Australian perovskite solar supply chain
summary_80w: Lava Blue has signed an MoU with HaloCell Energy to establish a supply chain for high-purity perovskite precursor materials in Australia.

headline: I Squared launches ANZA Power with US$300 million backing for Australia-New Zealand clean energy
summary_80w: I Squared Capital has launched ANZA Power, a new IPP aiming to deliver reliable and sustainable energy across Australia & New Zealand.

headline: Arizona utilities approve new technologies to accelerate residential storage and VPP deployment
summary_80w: FranklinWH and ConnectDER have had their respective battery and electric meter technologies enrolled into programmes in Arizona expected to accelerate the take-up of home batteries for virtual power plants (VPPs).

headline: Inlyte Energy completes UK factory acceptance test, CEO says US must ‘make better technologies’ than China
summary_80w: US-based iron-sodium battery manufacturer Inlyte Energy has successfully completed a factory acceptance test of its first field-ready battery at its facility near Derby, UK, witnessed by representatives from US utility Southern Company.

headline: German BESS flexibility platform and operator Terralayr raises €192 million
summary_80w: Virtual BESS tolling platform startup Terralayr has raised €192 million (US$223 million), primarily for its own build-own-operate BESS pipeline. CEO Philipp Man spoke to Energy-Storage.news about the funding round and growing its capacity virtualisation and tolling platform.

headline: Australian thermal storage startup 1414 Degrees bags GPS approval for 140MW BESS
summary_80w: Australian thermal energy storage company 1414 Degrees has received critical regulatory approval from AEMO for its 140MW Aurora BESS.

headline: Meta, Origis Energy ink 303MW solar PV PPA in Texas
summary_80w: Independent power producer (IPP) Origis Energy has signed a 303MW power purchase agreement with tech giant Meta for the Greyhound A Solar PV project in Texas.

headline: Vikram Solar to transition all module production to G12R format
summary_80w: Indian solar PV manufacturer Vikram Solar is transitioning its module portfolio to the G12R format, led by the HYPERSOL G12R series.

headline: Amazon buys 1.2GW Sunstone solar-plus-storage project from bankrupt Pine Gate
summary_80w: Global tech giant Amazon has been approved as the buyer of the 1.2GW Sunstone solar project in Oregon, one of the largest solar PV projects in the US.

headline: Altus Power acquires 105MW New York solar portfolio from Cordelio
summary_80w: US C&I solar developer Altus Power has acquired four solar projects with a total capacity of 105MW from IPP Cordelio Power.

headline: USPB dismisses two Maxeon patent claims against Canadian Solar, upholds a third
summary_80w: The Patent Trial and Appeal Board (PTAB) of the US Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) has partially ruled against solar manufacturer Maxeon in several claims against Canadian Solar.

headline: Australian government commits AU$24.7 million to national solar module recycling pilot
summary_80w: The Australian government has announced AU$24.7 million in funding over three years to establish a National Solar Panel Recycling Pilot.

headline: Polar Racking secures first Australian contract with 240MW Maryvale solar-plus-storage site
summary_80w: Canada-based solar mounting systems provider Polar Racking has entered the Australian market through its involvement in the 240MW Maryvale solar-plus-storage project in New South Wales, marking the company's first project deployment in the country.

headline: China deploys 65GWh of BESS in December, 25% of 2025 global total
summary_80w: A staggering total of 18GW/65GWh of large-scale BESS came online in China last month, accounting for a quarter of the total capacity deployed across the globe in 2025.

headline: US ROUNDUP: Duke Energy, Elevate, Fluence with BrightNight and Cordelio progress BESS projects
summary_80w: Duke Energy, Elevate Renewables, and Fluence Energy, along with BrightNight and Cordelio Power, are advancing BESS projects across the BESS.

headline: Year in Review: Flexibility is more valuable than ever, says Fluence
summary_80w: Fluence senior VP and chief enterprise operations officer Roman Loosen explains how 2025 saw energy storage go from "important" to "essential."

headline: DNV forecasts tenfold increase in MENA region’s installed energy storage capacity by 2030
summary_80w: DNV has forecast that the MENA region will add 860GW of new solar PV by 2040, and energy storage capacity will grow 10x by 2030.

headline: Australia’s pumped hydro pipeline swells with 2.15GW of new EPBC Act applications
summary_80w: Two pumped hydro energy storage (PHES) projects have been submitted for approval under Australia's Environment Protection and Biodiversity Conservation (EPBC) Act.

headline: EBRD backs 300MW of Masdar solar and energy storage in Uzbekistan
summary_80w: The European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (EBRD) will invest almost US$200 million in a 300MW/75MWh solar-plus-storage project in Uzbekistan.

headline: Origis Energy completes second phase of 300MW solar PV portfolio in Florida
summary_80w: Independent power producer (IPP) Origis Energy has completed the second phase of a 300MW solar PV project in Florida, US.

headline: Apex finances 670MW of energy storage, wind, with US$2.79 billion financial commitments
summary_80w: Developer Apex Clean Energy has announced financing of three utility-scale renewable energy projects across Texas, Ohio, and Illinois, including the Raven Storage project in Wharton County, Texas.

headline: EU’s delayed cybersecurity review could have big implications for solar
summary_80w: Analysis: Expected changes to the EU’s cybersecurity laws that could have significant implications for the continent’s solar industry have been delayed, reportedly due to disagreement between officials and member states over how far they should go.

headline: Enphase starts shipping GaN commercial microinverter
summary_80w: Enphase has begun US shipments of its new IQ9N-3P three-phase gallium nitride-based microinverter aimed at commercial rooftops.

headline: Neoen, SaskPower sign PPA for 157MW Mino Giizis solar project in Canada
summary_80w: Neoen has signed a 25-year PPA to sell electricity generated at its 157MW Mino Giizis project in Canada to SaskPower.

headline: NeoVolta, PotisEdge, Longi form JV for Georgia battery pack and BESS manufacturing facility
summary_80w: San Diego-based home battery storage company NeoVolta has formed NeoVolta Power, a joint venture (JV) to develop a US battery energy storage system (BESS) manufacturing platform in Pendergrass, Georgia.

headline: Post-MACSE dynamics make private tolls more attractive, IPP says
summary_80w: We hear from IPP Zelestra about its decision not to proceed in Italy's MACSE auction and the auction's wider implications on demand for private tolls.

headline: Torrent Power picks L&T to build India’s largest pumped hydro storage facility
summary_80w: Torrent Power has contracted Larsen & Toubro to construct a 3GW pumped hydro energy storage (PHES) plant in Maharashtra, India.

headline: BlackRock-backed Akaysha Energy weighs funding options for battery storage expansion
summary_80w: BlackRock-backed developer Akaysha Energy is reportedly considering options to raise additional funds, including selling a minority stake, to support the expansion of its battery energy storage operations.

headline: Australia: ASL unveils dual-track LTESA strategy as solar-battery hybrids reshape NSW energy market
summary_80w: ASL has launched a consultation on a new Hybrid Generation LTESA product alongside its 2026 NSW Consumer Trustee Investment Priorities.

headline: Battery storage costs fall 11-16% as Australia’s CSIRO maps least-cost route to net zero
summary_80w: While coal and gas power plants grapple with cost increases, Australia's battery storage sector delivers a different story, with costs plummeting across all durations.

headline: Solar dominated renewables workforce in 2024 – IRENA
summary_80w: Solar dominated employment in the renewable energy sector in 2024, accounting for over 40% of the global renewables workforce, the most of any sector.

headline: Lightsource bp, Toyota sign virtual PPA for 231MW Jones City 2 solar PV farm
summary_80w: Lightsource bp has signed a virtual PPA with Toyota Motor North America to sell electricity generated at its 231MW Jones City 2 solar farm.

headline: US court rules DOE cancellation of US$7.5 billion of clean energy grants unlawful
summary_80w: The US District Court of the District of Columbia has ruled that the Department of Energy’s (DOE) cancellation of awarded project grants constituted a violation of the Fifth Amendment’s guarantee of equal protection of the laws.

headline: DNV: MENA to add 860GW new solar PV by 2040
summary_80w: DNV has forecast that the Middle East and North Africa (MENA) region will add 860GW of new solar PV by 2040.

headline: Eging PV’s struggles reflect profitability challenges for Chinese solar producers
summary_80w: Analysis: As Eging PV comes under pressure to repay investment in an incomplete manufacturing facility, China’s solar manufacturers face an uphill struggle to put recent challenges behind them.

headline: Chinese solar imports and batteries drive 2.4GW of new solar deployment in Africa in 2025
summary_80w: Africa added 2.4GW of new solar PV capacity in 2025, an accomplishment dubbed by AFSIA CEO John van Zuylen as 'very positive'.

headline: Stellar PV unveils concept for 2GW Australian ingot and wafer facility
summary_80w: Australian start-up Stellar PV has released early details of the solar ingot and wafer facility it plans to build in the state of Queensland.

headline: Synergy awarded greenlight for 2GW wind, solar and battery storage site in Western Australia
summary_80w: SynergyRED, a wholly owned subsidiary of Synergy, has secured environmental approval for a 2GW solar, wind and battery energy storage system (BESS) project in Western Australia.

headline: New South Wales breaks 1TWh solar generation barrier as Australia’s renewables output surges in December 2025
summary_80w: Australia’s utility-scale solar PV and wind assets collectively generated 5,420GWh in December 2025, a 19% increase from the previous year’s 4,551GWh, according to Rystad Energy.

headline: Standardisation is making US BESS an easy target for cyberattacks
summary_80w: Energy-Storage.news Premium speaks with Phil Tonkin, field chief technology officer at Dragos, and Dr. Peter Fox-Penner, a Brattle principal, on BESS cybersecurity.

headline: Neoen and French TSO to trial grid-forming services with retrofitted BESS
summary_80w: IPP Neoen will provide Réseau de Transport d’Electricité (RTE) with grid-forming function from a BESS project in Brittany, France.

headline: Eolian and CyrusOne team up to deploy Texas data centre at site of 100MW BESS
summary_80w: Data centre developer CyrusOne and independent power producer (IPP) Eolian have announced the deployment of a 200MW data centre campus at a pre-existing grid-scale battery energy storage system (BESS) site in Fort Worth, Texas, US.

headline: Tesla and Sungrow top bankability report ratings, as integrators threaten to outperform cell suppliers
summary_80w: Tesla and Sungrow continue to top the Battery StorageTech Bankability Ratings Report, which also shows how revenue, profitability and shipments are trending in the industry, writes Solar Media Market Research analyst Joe Hennessy.

headline: HD Renewable Energy puts energy storage at centre of 2026 ‘overseas expansion year’ strategy
summary_80w: Taiwan-headquartered developer and services provider HD Renewable Energy (HDRE) is targeting further overseas expansion in 2026, with energy storage set to play a major role.

headline: Who’s driving the 300GWh boom in demand for AI data centre battery storage?
summary_80w: With the global AI data centre boom already here and growing rapidly, HiTHIUM brings products and strategies to help solve its significant energy challenges.

headline: UNSW: Solar module encapsulant materials and quality of construction affect damp heat performance
summary_80w: The use of POE as an encapsulant in TOPCon module construction could limit the effects of degradation on the module’s electricity generation.

headline: Illinois signs clean energy bill, will drive investments for solar PV, battery storage and VPPs
summary_80w: The Governor of Illinois, JB Pritzker, has signed a clean energy bill into law that will boost solar PV and energy storage investments in the state, among others.

headline: 505MWh BESS commissioned in Bulgaria, 2.2GWh progressed elsewhere in Europe
summary_80w: Another busy week of large-scale BESS project news across Europe, led by CountourGlobal putting a 202MW/505MWh BESS into commercial operation in Bulgaria.

headline: Developer Noveria talks BESS industry successes and challenges: ‘community acceptance is generally good’
summary_80w: The managing director of Bluestar Energy Capital's European BESS platform Noveria Energy gave a Q&A to Energy-Storage.news ahead of the Energy Storage Summit 2026 in London next month.

headline: Batteries ‘the only technology’ that can keep pace with AI data centre power fluctuations
summary_80w: Battery storage is the technology best suited to handling the power fluctuations that AI training loads can create at data centres, ESN Premium has heard.

headline: Another record-breaking year for UK battery storage as 4GWh comes online
summary_80w: The UK grid-scale battery storage market grew 45% in 2025, with 4GWh coming online during the year, bringing total operational capacity to 12.9GWh.

headline: South Australia leads AU$14,271/MW battery storage revenue surge in NEM’s first week of 2026
summary_80w: Aurora Energy Research has released its latest battery storage performance data, showing mixed revenue for storage across Australia's NEM.

headline: Horizon Power seeks federal approval for 239MWh solar-plus-storage site in Western Australia
summary_80w: Horizon Power has submitted an application under Australia's Environment Protection and Biodiversity Conservation (EPBC) Act for a 239MWh battery energy storage system (BESS) in Broome, Western Australia.

headline: Energy storage fleet mitigated 2TWh of renewables curtailment in Chile in 2025
summary_80w: Curtailment of solar PV and wind continued to increase in Chile last year and passed 6TWh according to the Chilean renewable energy and energy storage association ACERA.

headline: Year in Review: Analytics provider TWAICE on 2025’s BESS industry ‘wake-up call’ and operationalising data in 2026
summary_80w: Lennart Hinrichs at TWAICE, discusses how the industry’s approach to battery analytics is changing, as part of our annual Year in Review series.

headline: Terra-Gen puts 129MW/515MWh BESS in operation at California solar PV complex
summary_80w: Jointly owned by Masdar and Igneo Infrastructure Partners, independent power producer (IPP) Terra-Gen’s Lockhart CL I and II battery energy storage system (BESS) projects have reached commercial operations in San Bernardino County, California, US.

headline: German large-scale BESS projects have built industry confidence, but FCA, grid and revenue challenges remain
summary_80w: 2025 saw genuinely large-scale BESS projects start construction in Germany, strengthening confidence among stakeholders. But significant challenges remain around grid connection, connection agreements and access to revenue streams, an operator said.

headline: Year in Review: Sodium-ion startup Alsym on supply chains, safety and scale
summary_80w: Mukesh Chatter, CEO of US sodium-ion battery startup Alsym, on the prospects for non-lithium alternative technologies in 2026 and beyond.

headline: Australia’s battery storage fleet ‘facing challenges in extreme heatwave conditions’
summary_80w: Javier Savolainen of Wärtsilä explains how Australia's battery storage and pumped hydro fleet have been impacted by the current heatwave.

headline: Gamuda lands ECI contract for 2,400MWh Mortlake solar-plus-storage site in Australia
summary_80w: Yanara has appointed Gamuda Australia as the project delivery partner for the early contractor involvement (ECI) phase of the Mortlake Energy Hub in Victoria.
